items.message:
River levels are rising on the River Gaunless due to heavy rainfall.

River levels are expected to peak around 08:00 PM on 14/08/2023 but will remain high overnight.

The rainfall is expected to continue until the early hours of the morning on 15/08/2023. 

We have cleared the debris from trash screens in the area.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water.

We are not expecting to issue any flood warnings but are closely monitoring river levels.  

This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 15/08/2023, or as the situation changes.

River levels have risen on the River Ure due to rainfall. The areas most at risk are low lying roads, paths and farmland near watercourses. Flooding of these areas near Low Houses and Bainbridge is possible from 18:00 on 14/08/2023. Further light rainfall is forecast overnight. We will continue to monitor levels closely. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. This message will be updated by 9pm on 14/08/2023, or as the situation changes.
